lessons.title: Rule of Thirds
lessons.content: The rule of thirds is a simple way to improve photo composition. Imagine breaking your image into 9 equal parts using two horizontal and two vertical lines.
lessons.content2: Placing your subject along these lines or at their intersections makes the photo more balanced and visually appealing.

lessons.title: Rule of Thirds
lessons.content: Below is a good and bad example for rule of thirds composition.

lessons.title: Rule of Thirds Grid on iOS: Photos
steps: Open the Settings app on your iPhone.
Scroll down and tap on 'Camera'.
Toggle the 'Grid' switch to ON (green).
Open the Camera app.
You’ll now see a 3x3 grid overlay — use this to align subjects according to the Rule of Thirds.

lessons.content: Changing the exposure level changes how bright or dark your photo is.
lessons.content2: Getting the right exposure means your photo isn’t too dark (underexposed) or too bright (overexposed), so details are clear and colors look natural.

Exposure

lessons.title: Adjusting Exposure on iOS: Photos
steps: Open the Photos app and choose the photo you want to edit.
Tap 'Edit' in the top right corner.
Swipe through the adjustment tools and tap on 'Exposure'.
Drag the slider right to brighten the photo or left to darken it.
Tap 'Done' to save your changes.

lessons.title: Hue
lessons.content: Hue refers to the pure spectrum colors commonly referred to by color names - red, orange, yellow, blue, green violet - which appear in the hue circle or rainbow.

lessons.title: Hue
lessons.content: Slide the hue slider to change the color of the image.

lessons.title: Adjusting Hue on iOS: Adobe Lightroom
steps: In Lightroom, tap Color > Mix.
Tap a color (e.g., red, blue, green).
Adjust the Hue slider to shift the tone: Red → Orange, Blue → Purple, etc.
Repeat for each color you want to shift.
Tap ✓ when done.

lessons.title: Saturation
lessons.content: Saturation refers to the intensity or purity of a color. A highly saturated color is vivid, while a less saturated color appears more muted or gray.

lessons.title: Saturation
lessons.content: Slide the saturation slider to change the intensity of the color.

lessons.title: Adjusting Saturation on iOS: Photos
steps: Open the Photos app and select the photo you want to edit.
Tap 'Edit' in the top right corner.
Swipe through the adjustment tools and tap on 'Saturation'.
Drag the slider right to increase saturation or left to decrease it.
Tap 'Done' to save your edits.
